mixed-citation.named-content: Arcofaciella indiana Chen & Yang 2021, sp. nov.
mixed-citation.article-title: Review the bamboo-feeding genus Arcofaciella Fennah, 1956 (Hemiptera: Fulgoromorpha: Delphacidae) with description of a new species from India

tp:treatment-sec.p:
Arcofaciella indiana
sp. nov. can be distinguished from the remaining species of the genus by the frons in profile ( Figs 1I , 2B ) not inclined anteriorly, the clypeus in profile ( Figs 1I , 2B ) bent at obtuse angle to frons, the presence of a median carina on the clypeus ( Fig. 2C ), and the genital styles with inner apical angle not bifurcate ( Fig. 2H–J ).
This new species is named after the type locality, India .

Paratype INDIA • 1 ♀ ; same collection data as for holotype; GUGC-FDTA-19720802
.

MEASUREMENTS. Body length including forewing: male ( holotype , GUGC-FDTA-19720801) 4.3 mm (N = 1); female ( paratype , GUGC-FDTA-19720802) 4.6 mm (N = 1); forewing length: male ( holotype ) 3.8 mm (N = 1); female ( paratype ) 4.0 mm (N = 1).
